title: Save up to 34% on the Google Pixel 7a!
description: It's an older model, but it's capable of serving as a reliable daily smartphone. The post Save up to 34% on the Google Pixel 7a! appeared first on Phandroid.
author: Mike Viray
excerpt: It's an older model, but it's capable of serving as a reliable daily smartphone.
text: If you’re interested in checking out Google’s Pixel Android phones, then you might want to look into its A-series models, which offer some pretty great features at reasonably affordable prices. Take for example the Pixel 7a, which is currently on sale right now – it’s an older model, but it’s capable of serving as a reliable daily smartphone. As for hardware specs, the phone comes with a compact 6.1-inch display with a smooth 90Hz refresh rate, and a dual-camera setup on the rear which includes a 64-megapixel main camera and an ultrawide lens, with support for a nice selection of camera modes and 4K video recording. The phone also features a sleek-looking design with a handful of different color options. Google has also included a ton of helpful AI software features, including monthly software updates for security and apps. You can check it out using the link below. Note: this article may contain affiliate links that help support our authors and keep the Phandroid servers running.
html:
If you’re interested in checking out Google’s Pixel Android phones, then you might want to look into its A-series models, which offer some pretty great features at reasonably affordable prices. Take for example the Pixel 7a, which is currently on sale right now – it’s an older model, but it’s capable of serving as a reliable daily smartphone.

As for hardware specs, the phone comes with a compact 6.1-inch display with a smooth 90Hz refresh rate, and a dual-camera setup on the rear which includes a 64-megapixel main camera and an ultrawide lens, with support for a nice selection of camera modes and 4K video recording. The phone also features a sleek-looking design with a handful of different color options.

Google has also included a ton of helpful AI software features, including monthly software updates for security and apps. You can check it out using the link below.
